Description: Omphalos of probably Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; much worn; exterior glazed streaky black (mostly worn); trace of added red on top of omphalos; added white tongue pattern around base of omphalos; interior roughly glazed and seemingly unslipped.
Curator's comments: It is not clear whether this piece was slipped white on either side. The omphalos is much broader than on comparable pieces.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 306, possibly no. 1216) (Number not precised)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1998) (phase 2)
